content: Hello all. In England we are exploring the potential and scope for an industry led FHIR initiative and as such we are naturally looking at the work in the US around DAF and Argonaut. I'm still unclear as to the relationship (if any) between these projects. If someone could point me in the direction of any links that will clarify that would be appreciated.

One possible way of articulating the relationship, as documented in the Argonaut implementation guide (http://argonautwiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Implementation_Guide), is "The Argonaut data element query is based on the HL7 U.S. Data Access Framework (DAF) FHIR Implementation Guide. However, the Argonaut use case and requirements per resource are a subset of those of the DAF implementation guide". CC: @Brett Marquard
Thanks @Michelle (Moseman) Miller that's just what I needed.

note though, that Argonaut is varying from DAF where implementation experience shows that we can't go as far as DAF did, or where we find we can go further. We are feeding these decisions back to DAF, and they are a primary - but not only - feedback to a future version
Can someone point me to the most current DAF profiles....stuff's moving around! ;)
There's no automated build process for IGs right now, so that may be a bit out-of-date
If you have build downloaded - the source material is under guides/daf2. Update on HL7.org requires Grahame to give the build a hug.
Is Grahame currently on that friendly a relationship with the build? :)
